user.title: Kubernetes Configuration
user.description: Enter your Kubernetes cluster connection details.

data_description.cluster_name: A friendly name to identify this Kubernetes cluster in Home Assistant. This name will be used as the integration name and for device identification.
data_description.host: The hostname or IP address of your Kubernetes API server. Do not include the protocol (http:// or https://).
data_description.port: The port number for the Kubernetes API server.
data_description.api_token: A valid Kubernetes service account token with appropriate RBAC permissions. This token is used to authenticate API requests to your cluster. It is required to access the Kubernetes API.
data_description.ca_cert: Optional path to your cluster's CA certificate file. Required if using self-signed certificates or custom Certificate Authorities. Leave empty if using standard certificates.
data_description.verify_ssl: Whether to verify SSL certificates when connecting to the Kubernetes API. Disable this only for self-signed certificates or development environments.
data_description.monitor_all_namespaces: When enabled, the integration will monitor all namespaces in your cluster. When disabled, you will be prompted to select specific namespaces to monitor. Requires cluster-wide permissions when enabled.
data_description.switch_update_interval: How often (in seconds) the integration polls the Kubernetes API to update switch states. Lower values provide more responsive switches but increase API load.
data_description.scale_verification_timeout: Maximum time (in seconds) to wait for scaling operations to complete before timing out. Increase this value for slow clusters or large deployments.
data_description.scale_cooldown: Cooldown period (in seconds) after scaling operations before allowing another scale operation. This prevents rapid successive scaling requests.
data_description.device_grouping_mode: Choose how entities are organized in Home Assistant. Group by Namespace creates a device for each namespace, while Group by Cluster creates a single device containing all nodes, sensors, and entities.

namespaces.title: Select Namespaces to Monitor
namespaces.description:
Choose which Kubernetes namespaces you want to monitor. You can select multiple namespaces from the list below. Only resources in the selected namespaces will be monitored by this integration.

**Tip:** Use the dropdown to search and select namespaces. Selected namespaces will appear as chips that can be removed by clicking the X icon.

error.cannot_connect: Failed to connect to Kubernetes cluster
error.cannot_fetch_namespaces: Failed to fetch namespaces from cluster. Please check your connection settings and permissions.
error.kubernetes_not_installed: Kubernetes Python package is not installed. Please install it using: pip install kubernetes==33.1.0
error.at_least_one_namespace_required: At least one namespace is required when not monitoring all namespaces
